text: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 10 November 2022
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/77/L.11)]
77/10.	The situation in Afghanistan
The General Assembly,
Recalling its resolution 75/90 of 10 December 2020 and all its previous relevant resolutions,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolution 75/90 of 10 December 2020 and all its previous relevant resolutions,

text: Recalling also all relevant Security Council resolutions, in particular resolution 2626 (2022) of 17 March 2022, and statements by the President of the Council on the situation in Afghanistan,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* all relevant {{Security Council}} resolutions, in particular resolution 2626 (2022) of 17 March 2022, and statements by the {{President of the Council}} on the situation in {{Afghanistan}},
uncertainties: "President of the Council" is assumed to mean the President of the Security Council; this role is not in the provided entity list, so it is classified as other and normalized accordingly.

text: Reaffirming its strong commitment to the sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and national unity of Afghanistan, and respecting its multicultural, multi-ethnic and historical heritage,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its strong commitment to the sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and national unity of {{Afghanistan}}, and respecting its multicultural, multi-ethnic and historical heritage,
uncertainties: The paragraph also contains the participle clause "respecting its multicultural, multi-ethnic and historical heritage," which is not included as an operative verb since "respect" is not in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs.

text: Strongly emphasizing the importance of the establishment of an inclusive and representative government, and further emphasizing the importance of upholding human rights, including for women, children and persons belonging to minorities, and of promoting full, equal, meaningful and safe participation of women in all aspects of Afghan society,
textWithHighlights: *Strongly emphasizing* the importance of the establishment of an inclusive and representative government, and *further emphasizing* the importance of upholding human rights, including for women, children and persons belonging to minorities, and of promoting full, equal, meaningful and safe participation of women in all aspects of Afghan society,

text: Reiterating the vital importance of Afghanistan achieving lasting peace, sustainable development, rehabilitation and economic stability as well as the elimination of all threats, which still pose tremendous challenges for the stability of Afghanistan and regional security,
textWithHighlights: *Reiterating* the vital importance of {{Afghanistan}} achieving lasting peace, sustainable development, rehabilitation and economic stability as well as the elimination of all threats, which still pose tremendous challenges for the stability of {{Afghanistan}} and regional security,

text: Expressing its deep concern regarding the dire economic and humanitarian situation in Afghanistan, including alarming levels of food insecurity, and recognizing the need to help to address the substantial challenges facing the economy of Afghanistan, including through efforts to restore the banking and financial systems and enabling access to assets belonging to the Central Bank of Afghanistan for the benefit of the Afghan people, as well as the need to strengthen efforts to provide humanitarian assistance and other activities that support basic human needs in Afghanistan, including unhindered humanitarian access,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing its deep concern* regarding the dire economic and humanitarian situation in {{Afghanistan}}, including alarming levels of food insecurity, and *recognizing* the need to help to address the substantial challenges facing the economy of Afghanistan, including through efforts to restore the banking and financial systems and enabling access to assets belonging to the {{Central Bank of Afghanistan}} for the benefit of the Afghan people, as well as the need to strengthen efforts to provide humanitarian assistance and other activities that support basic human needs in Afghanistan, including unhindered humanitarian access,

text: Reiterating its serious concern about the security situation in Afghanistan and the urgent need to overcome the challenges facing the country and its civilian population, in particular the threat posed by terrorist groups, such as Al-Qaida and Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh) and their affiliates, including ISIL-Khorasan Province, to Afghanistan and the region, and cautioning against attempts to derail peace and stability in Afghanistan,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)

textWithHighlights: *Reiterating* its serious concern about the security situation in {{Afghanistan}} and the urgent need to overcome the challenges facing the country and its civilian population, in particular the threat posed by terrorist groups, such as {{Al-Qaida}} and {{Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)}} and their affiliates, including {{ISIL-Khorasan Province}}, to {{Afghanistan}} and the region, and *cautioning* against attempts to derail peace and stability in {{Afghanistan}},
uncertainties: The verb 'cautioning' is not in the provided operative verb list; treated as a preambular/evaluative verb without assignees or deliverables.

text: Emphasizing the important role of regional cooperation to promote long-term stability, peace, security, prosperity, sustainable development and human rights in Afghanistan, and welcoming the efforts by regional organizations, international partners and regional and neighbouring countries in this regard,
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizing* the important role of regional cooperation to promote long-term stability, peace, security, prosperity, sustainable development and human rights in Afghanistan, and *welcoming* the efforts by {{regional organizations}}, {{international partners}} and {{regional and neighbouring countries}} in this regard,
uncertainties: "International partners" is a broad term; treated as an 'other' mentioned entity. "Regional and neighbouring countries" is mapped as a Member States group using an open description.

text: Noting the first annual report on human rights of the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan, released in July 2022, and the report of the Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in Afghanistan released in September 2022,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in Afghanistan
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in Afghanistan

textWithHighlights: *Noting* the first annual report on human rights of the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}}, released in July 2022, and the report of the {{Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in Afghanistan}} released in September 2022,
uncertainties: Classification of the Special Rapporteur as 'other' (instead of UN System) since Special Procedures are not explicitly listed.

text: Recalling the Organization of Islamic Cooperation Plan of Action for the Advancement of Women, which recognizes the importance of the inclusion of women in decision-making processes, full and equal access to education for boys and girls at all levels, women’s and girls’ access to quality health care and services, equal economic opportunities for men and women, equal access to humanitarian assistance, and combating all forms of violence against women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the {{Organization of Islamic Cooperation}} Plan of Action for the Advancement of Women, which recognizes the importance of the inclusion of women in decision-making processes, full and equal access to education for boys and girls at all levels, women’s and girls’ access to quality health care and services, equal economic opportunities for men and women, equal access to humanitarian assistance, and combating all forms of violence against women and girls,

text: Stressing the central and impartial role of the United Nations in promoting peace and stability in Afghanistan, expressing its appreciation and strong support for all the efforts of the Secretary-General and his Special Representative for Afghanistan in this regard, and expressing its appreciation and full support, in particular, for the work of the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan

textWithHighlights: *Stressing* the central and impartial role of the {{United Nations}} in promoting peace and stability in Afghanistan, *expressing* its appreciation and strong support for all the efforts of the {{Secretary-General}} and his {{Special Representative for Afghanistan}} in this regard, and *expressing* its appreciation and full support, in particular, for the work of the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}},
uncertainties: The verb 'expressing' is normalized as 'appreciate' and 'support' to fit the controlled list of operative verbs. 'Special Representative for Afghanistan' is not in the provided entity list; it is normalized here as 'SRSG-Afghanistan' under UN Secretariat.

text: Welcoming the reports of the Secretary-General,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the reports of the {{Secretary-General}},

text: Expresses deep concern over the developments and the volatility in Afghanistan since the takeover of the Taliban, and the dire economic, humanitarian and social conditions, persistent violence and the presence of terrorist groups, the absence of political inclusivity and representative decision-making, as well as abuse of human rights, including those of women, girls and persons belonging to minorities;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses deep concern* over the developments and the volatility in {{Afghanistan}} since the takeover of the {{Taliban}}, and the dire economic, humanitarian and social conditions, persistent violence and the presence of terrorist groups, the absence of political inclusivity and representative decision-making, as well as abuse of human rights, including those of women, girls and persons belonging to minorities;

text: Maintains that sustainable and lasting peace can be achieved only through long-term social, economic and political stability, which requires full respect for civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights as well as commitment to inclusive and representative governance;
textWithHighlights: *Maintains* that sustainable and lasting peace can be achieved only through long-term social, economic and political stability, which requires full respect for civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights as well as commitment to inclusive and representative governance;
uncertainties: The verb "maintains" is used as an assertion (akin to "states"). Although "maintain" appears in the provided list under deciding verbs, here it functions observationally; thus it is normalized to "state" and classified as observing. No concrete tasks or assignees are present.

text: Pledges its continued support to the people of Afghanistan in order to rebuild a stable, secure and economically self-sufficient State, free of terrorism, narcotics, transnational organized crime, including trafficking in persons, and corruption, and to strengthen the foundations of a constitutional democracy as a responsible member of the international community;
textWithHighlights: *Pledges* its continued support to the people of {{Afghanistan}} in order to rebuild a stable, secure and economically self-sufficient State, free of terrorism, narcotics, transnational organized crime, including trafficking in persons, and corruption, and to strengthen the foundations of a constitutional democracy as a responsible member of the {{international community}};

text: Acknowledges the efforts of the international community, including neighbouring countries, donor agencies and other international organizations in urgent provision of humanitarian assistance to Afghanistan, and emphasizes that long-term peace, security, prosperity and sustainable development in Afghanistan and the region require closer and more effective cooperation as well as greater coherence and complementarity of approach within the international community;
textWithHighlights: *Acknowledges* the efforts of the {{international community}}, including {{neighbouring countries}}, {{donor agencies}} and other {{international organizations}} in urgent provision of humanitarian assistance to {{Afghanistan}}, and *emphasizes* that long-term peace, security, prosperity and sustainable development in {{Afghanistan}} and the region require closer and more effective cooperation as well as greater coherence and complementarity of approach within the {{international community}};
uncertainties: "donor agencies" is a broad category and does not map cleanly to a specific entity type; categorized as 'other'. Highlighted "international organizations" (without "other") for concise core noun phrase.

text: Reaffirms its expectation that the Taliban live up to their commitments regarding the safe, secure and orderly departure from Afghanistan of all Afghans willing to leave and of all foreign nationals, with no one preventing them from travelling from the country, as well as facilitating the voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return of all refugees, and also reaffirms its expectation that the Taliban build upon their announcement of general amnesty to encourage the return of former Afghan officials and to promote inclusivity in the governance of Afghanistan;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Safe, secure and orderly departure from Afghanistan
Voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return of refugees
Build upon general amnesty
Encourage return of former Afghan officials
Promote inclusivity in the governance of Afghanistan
deliverables.deliverable: inclusivity in the governance of Afghanistan

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* its expectation that the <<Taliban>> live up to their commitments regarding the [[safe, secure and orderly departure]] from Afghanistan of all Afghans willing to leave and of all foreign nationals, with no one preventing them from travelling from the country, as well as facilitating the voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable [[return of all refugees]], and also *reaffirms* its expectation that the <<Taliban>> build upon their announcement of [[general amnesty]] to encourage the [[return of former Afghan officials]] and to promote [[inclusivity in the governance of Afghanistan]];
uncertainties: The Taliban are treated as an assignee (non-UN actor) under 'other'; the paragraph uses a reinforcing verb rather than a directive one, but it conveys concrete expectations. Deliverable categorization is approximate: departures/returns as humanitarian assistance; amnesty, return of officials, and inclusivity as policy-related.

text: Urges Afghanistan to honour and fully respect and implement all treaties, covenants or conventions, bilateral or multilateral, to which it is party;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Afghanistan>> to honour and fully respect and implement all treaties, covenants or conventions, bilateral or multilateral, to which it is party;

text: Calls upon the Taliban to fulfil and respect their assurances for the safety and security of diplomatic personnel and premises, humanitarian workers and international organizations in Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* the <<Taliban>> to fulfil and respect their assurances for the safety and security of diplomatic personnel and premises, humanitarian workers and {{international organizations}} in {{Afghanistan}};

text: Emphasizes that relations of all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders with the international community will be informed by their commitments, actions and achievements with regard to the expectations of the Afghan people widely shared by the international community;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* that relations of all relevant {{Afghan political actors and stakeholders}} with the {{international community}} will be informed by their commitments, actions and achievements with regard to the expectations of the Afghan people widely shared by the {{international community}};
uncertainties: Considered whether to include 'Afghan political actors and stakeholders' as a mentioned entity; treated it as 'other'. Did not mark 'Afghan people' as a mentioned entity as it is not an organization or person per the schema focus.

text: Human rights, governance and the rule of law

Expresses its deep concern about abuse of human rights, especially those of women and girls, including sexual violence, and persons belonging to minorities, and about the growing repression of fundamental freedoms, recalls the obligations of Afghanistan under international law, in particular human rights, refugee and humanitarian law, and stresses the need to ensure respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms, in particular the full enjoyment by women and girls, children, persons with disabilities and persons belonging to minorities of their human rights;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses its deep concern* about abuse of human rights, especially those of women and girls, including sexual violence, and persons belonging to minorities, and about the growing repression of fundamental freedoms, *recalls* the obligations of {{Afghanistan}} under international law, in particular human rights, refugee and humanitarian law, and *stresses* the need to ensure respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms, in particular the full enjoyment by women and girls, children, persons with disabilities and persons belonging to minorities of their human rights;

text: Reiterates its unwavering commitment to international humanitarian law and the human rights of all Afghans, emphasizing the importance of the meaningful participation of women in all spheres of life and of upholding human rights, including for women, children and persons belonging to minorities, expresses, in particular, its serious concern about the situation of women and girls, the imposition of restrictions on their full, equal, meaningful and safe participation in public life, including their freedom of movement, and the lack of equal access to education, especially the decision by the Taliban not to reopen secondary schools to Afghan girls, economic and job opportunities, justice and other services, and calls upon the Taliban to reverse the policies and practices restricting the enjoyment of human rights and fundamental freedoms by Afghan women and girls;

mandates.action_verb: expresses, in particular, its serious concern

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Reversal of policies and practices restricting the rights of Afghan women and girls

textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* its unwavering commitment to international humanitarian law and the human rights of all Afghans, emphasizing the importance of the meaningful participation of women in all spheres of life and of upholding human rights, including for women, children and persons belonging to minorities, *expresses, in particular, its serious concern* about the situation of women and girls, the imposition of restrictions on their full, equal, meaningful and safe participation in public life, including their freedom of movement, and the lack of equal access to education, especially the decision by the {{Taliban}} not to reopen secondary schools to Afghan girls, economic and job opportunities, justice and other services, and *calls upon* the <<Taliban>> to [[reverse the policies and practices]] restricting the enjoyment of human rights and fundamental freedoms by Afghan women and girls;
uncertainties: Did not treat the subordinate participle 'emphasizing' as an operative verb. Chose deliverable type 'policy' for reversing restrictive policies/practices; could arguably be categorized differently depending on context.

text: Emphasizes the need to ensure respect for the human rights and fundamental freedoms of children in Afghanistan and to end and prevent all abuses against children, encourages the full implementation of the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Optional Protocols thereto, and strongly condemns all forms of violence against children;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Full implementation of the Convention on the Rights of the Child and its Optional Protocols

textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the need to ensure respect for the human rights and fundamental freedoms of children in Afghanistan and to end and prevent all abuses against children, *encourages* the [[full implementation]] of the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Optional Protocols thereto, and *strongly condemns* all forms of violence against children;
uncertainties: No explicit assignee is stated for the directive verb 'encourages'; it is likely aimed at Member States and Afghan authorities, but the text does not specify.

text: Reiterates the importance of dialogue between all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders with a focus on the establishment of inclusive, representative, participatory and responsive governance at the national and subnational levels, without any discrimination based on gender, religion or ethnicity, with the full, equal, meaningful and safe participation of women and the meaningful participation of persons belonging to minorities, youth and persons with disabilities;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* the importance of dialogue between all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders with a focus on the establishment of inclusive, representative, participatory and responsive governance at the national and subnational levels, without any discrimination based on gender, religion or ethnicity, with the full, equal, meaningful and safe participation of women and the meaningful participation of persons belonging to minorities, youth and persons with disabilities;

text: Strongly emphasizes the necessity of investigating allegations of current and past human rights abuses and violations in Afghanistan, and stresses the importance of facilitating the provision of efficient and effective remedies to the victims and survivors and of bringing those responsible to justice in accordance with national and international law;
textWithHighlights: *Strongly emphasizes* the necessity of investigating allegations of current and past human rights abuses and violations in {{Afghanistan}}, and *stresses* the importance of facilitating the provision of efficient and effective remedies to the victims and survivors and of bringing those responsible to justice in accordance with national and international law;

text: Condemns in particular all attacks, reprisals and violence against journalists and media workers, as well as the particular restrictions that women media workers face, urges that the perpetrators of harassment of and attacks on journalists be brought to justice in accordance with national and international law, and urges all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders to ensure and respect freedom of opinion and expression, media freedom and access to media;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Bring perpetrators of harassment and attacks on journalists to justice
Ensure and respect freedom of opinion and expression
Ensure and respect media freedom
Ensure and respect access to media

textWithHighlights: *Condemns* in particular all attacks, reprisals and violence against journalists and media workers, as well as the particular restrictions that women media workers face, *urges* that the perpetrators of harassment of and attacks on journalists be [[brought to justice]] in accordance with national and international law, and *urges* all relevant <<Afghan political actors and stakeholders>> to ensure and respect [[freedom of opinion and expression]], [[media freedom]] and [[access to media]];
uncertainties: 'Bringing perpetrators to justice' is a concrete action but does not map cleanly to the provided deliverable categories; classified as 'policy' as the closest fit.

text: Expresses its concern about reports of extrajudicial punishments, such as reprisals and summary executions, disappearances and detentions, including those against former members of the Afghan National Defence and Security Forces and other officials;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Afghan National Defence and Security Forces
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Afghan National Defence and Security Forces

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its concern* about reports of extrajudicial punishments, such as reprisals and summary executions, disappearances and detentions, including those against former members of the {{Afghan National Defence and Security Forces}} and other officials;

text: Reiterates that sustained and effective efforts in fighting corruption in Afghanistan remain critical for the country’s future, and urges all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders to promote the rule of law and address impunity for corruption, and establish a more effective, accountable and transparent administration at the national, provincial and local levels;

assignees.assignee: all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders

textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* that sustained and effective efforts in fighting corruption in {{Afghanistan}} remain critical for the country’s future, and *urges* all relevant <<Afghan political actors and stakeholders>> to promote the rule of law and address impunity for corruption, and establish a more effective, accountable and transparent administration at the national, provincial and local levels;
uncertainties: Considered marking deliverables (promote the rule of law; address impunity; establish more effective, accountable and transparent administration), but judged them too broad/vague to classify under the deliverable types with sufficient concreteness.

text: Security, counter-terrorism and counter-narcotics

Reiterates its serious concern about the security situation and the continuing violence in Afghanistan, the presence of terrorist groups such as Al-Qaida and Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh) and their affiliates, including ISIL-Khorasan Province, as well as the presence of foreign terrorist fighters, and expresses its serious concern about cowardly and heinous attacks by ISIL-Khorasan Province against civilians and civilian infrastructure, which have especially targeted educational facilities, diplomatic premises and personnel and religious sites belonging to minorities, as well as deplorable attempts to undermine relations between communities, posing a serious threat to the security of Afghanistan, its immediate neighbours and the countries of the region;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)

textWithHighlights: *Reiterates its serious concern* about the security situation and the continuing violence in {{Afghanistan}}, the presence of terrorist groups such as {{Al-Qaida}} and {{Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)}} and their affiliates, including {{ISIL-Khorasan Province}}, as well as the presence of foreign terrorist fighters, and *expresses its serious concern* about cowardly and heinous attacks by {{ISIL-Khorasan Province}} against civilians and civilian infrastructure, which have especially targeted educational facilities, diplomatic premises and personnel and religious sites belonging to minorities, as well as deplorable attempts to undermine relations between communities, posing a serious threat to the security of {{Afghanistan}}, its immediate neighbours and the countries of the region;

text: Reaffirms the importance of combating terrorism in Afghanistan, including those individuals and groups designated by the Security Council Committee pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999), 1989 (2011) and 2253 (2015) and of preventing violent extremism as and when conducive to terrorism, demands that the territory of Afghanistan not be used as a platform or safe haven by any terrorist group, organization or individual to threaten or attack any country, to plan or finance terrorist acts or to shelter and train terrorists, and that no Afghan group or individual should support terrorists operating on the territory of any country, and calls upon the Taliban to take concrete steps against all terrorist organizations, in particular Al-Qaida and Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh) and their affiliates;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the importance of combating terrorism in Afghanistan, including those individuals and groups designated by the {{Security Council Committee}} pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999), 1989 (2011) and 2253 (2015) and of preventing violent extremism as and when conducive to terrorism, *demands* that the territory of Afghanistan not be used as a platform or safe haven by any terrorist group, organization or individual to threaten or attack any country, to plan or finance terrorist acts or to shelter and train terrorists, and that no Afghan group or individual should support terrorists operating on the territory of any country, and *calls upon* the <<Taliban>> to take concrete steps against all terrorist organizations, in particular {{Al-Qaida}} and {{Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) (Da’esh)}} and their affiliates;
uncertainties: Normalized the mentioned entity 'Security Council Committee' to 'SC' due to lack of a specific committee entry in the entity list.

text: Recognizes that terrorism has devastating consequences on the human rights and fundamental freedoms of victims and their families, deplores the suffering of the people of Afghanistan, and reaffirms its profound solidarity with them, and emphasizes the need to promote international solidarity in support of victims of terrorism and to ensure that victims of terrorism are treated with dignity and respect, and that their right to access to justice and redress mechanisms, as provided for in applicable domestic law and in accordance with principles of international law, is fully respected;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* that terrorism has devastating consequences on the human rights and fundamental freedoms of victims and their families, *deplores* the suffering of the people of {{Afghanistan}}, and *reaffirms* its profound solidarity with them, and *emphasizes* the need to promote international solidarity in support of victims of terrorism and to ensure that victims of terrorism are treated with dignity and respect, and that their right to access to justice and redress mechanisms, as provided for in applicable domestic law and in accordance with principles of international law, is fully respected;

text: Stresses the need for neighbouring and regional countries and the international community to continue to work closely together and to improve coordination in countering all acts of terrorism and the associated threats, including the threat posed by foreign terrorist fighters and terrorism financing in Afghanistan and the region, and affirms its support for continued efforts in this regard;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the need for {{neighbouring and regional countries}} and the {{international community}} to continue to work closely together and to improve coordination in countering all acts of terrorism and the associated threats, including the threat posed by foreign terrorist fighters and terrorism financing in {{Afghanistan}} and the region, and *affirms* its support for continued efforts in this regard;
uncertainties: The operative verb "affirms" is not in the provided exhaustive verb list; I categorized it as a reinforcing verb and normalized it to "reaffirm" as the closest match.

text: Remains deeply concerned about the persistent harm to civilians, including the disproportionate impact on children, caused by anti-personnel landmines, explosive remnants of war, improvised explosive devices and weapons, encourages all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders to continue efforts to eradicate the threat posed by anti-personnel landmines and improvised explosive devices, and encourages steps towards addressing the illicit trade in and destabilizing accumulation of small arms and light weapons in Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Remains deeply concerned* about the persistent harm to civilians, including the disproportionate impact on children, caused by anti-personnel landmines, explosive remnants of war, improvised explosive devices and weapons, *encourages* all relevant <<Afghan political actors and stakeholders>> to continue efforts to eradicate the threat posed by anti-personnel landmines and improvised explosive devices, and *encourages* steps towards addressing the illicit trade in and destabilizing accumulation of small arms and light weapons in {{Afghanistan}};
uncertainties: No concrete deliverables identified; phrases like 'continue efforts to eradicate the threat' and 'steps towards addressing' are considered too vague to categorize as specific tasks.

text: Expresses its continued deep concern at the undiminished serious threat and harm that illicit opium cultivation and methamphetamine production as well as consumption and trafficking of these drugs continue to cause to the security, development and governance of Afghanistan, as well as to the region and beyond, and, recognizing that such activities can significantly contribute to the financial resources of terrorist groups operating in the region, calls upon States to strengthen international and regional cooperation to counter this threat, and recognizes the important role played by neighbouring countries of Afghanistan in combating and countering international drug trafficking, as well as the efforts of the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its continued deep concern* at the undiminished serious threat and harm that illicit opium cultivation and methamphetamine production as well as consumption and trafficking of these drugs continue to cause to the security, development and governance of Afghanistan, as well as to the region and beyond, and, recognizing that such activities can significantly contribute to the financial resources of terrorist groups operating in the region, *calls upon* <<States>> to strengthen international and regional cooperation to counter this threat, and *recognizes* the important role played by {{neighbouring countries of Afghanistan}} in combating and countering international drug trafficking, as well as the efforts of the {{United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime}};
uncertainties: Considered treating 'strengthen international and regional cooperation' as a deliverable, but deemed too vague/non-concrete to classify.

text: Stresses the importance of the narcotics ban on the cultivation, production, trafficking and consumption of illicit drugs, takes note of the announcement by the Taliban of a ban on opium cultivation and calls for its full implementation, and emphasizes the importance of a comprehensive and balanced approach in addressing the drug problem of Afghanistan, which, to be effective, must be integrated into the wider context of efforts carried out in the areas of security, governance, the rule of law, human rights, public health and economic and social development, in particular in rural areas, including the development of improved alternative livelihood programmes;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Full implementation of the opium cultivation ban

textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of the narcotics ban on the cultivation, production, trafficking and consumption of illicit drugs, *takes note* of the announcement by the {{Taliban}} of a ban on opium cultivation and *calls for* its [[full implementation]], and *emphasizes* the importance of a comprehensive and balanced approach in addressing the drug problem of {{Afghanistan}}, which, to be effective, must be integrated into the wider context of efforts carried out in the areas of security, governance, the rule of law, human rights, public health and economic and social development, in particular in rural areas, including the development of improved alternative livelihood programmes;
uncertainties: The deliverable 'full implementation' is interpreted as implementation of the opium cultivation ban; categorized as 'policy' though one could argue enforcement/implementation nuances. The clause mentioning 'development of improved alternative livelihood programmes' describes elements of an approach rather than issuing a directive; therefore it was not extracted as a deliverable.

text: Notes with great concern the strong nexus between drug trafficking and terrorism in Afghanistan, stresses the importance of continued attention to the linkages in Afghanistan between the proceeds of organized crime, inter alia, the illicit production of and trafficking in drugs and their chemical precursors and the financing, respectively, of those individuals and groups designated by the Security Council Committee pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999), 1989 (2011) and 2253 (2015), and underscores the need to improve the necessary capacity of the relevant Afghan institutions to address challenges posed by terrorism, narcotics, smuggling, money-laundering and organized crime;
textWithHighlights: *Notes with great concern* the strong nexus between drug trafficking and terrorism in Afghanistan, *stresses* the importance of continued attention to the linkages in Afghanistan between the proceeds of organized crime, inter alia, the illicit production of and trafficking in drugs and their chemical precursors and the financing, respectively, of those individuals and groups designated by the {{Security Council Committee}} pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999), 1989 (2011) and 2253 (2015), and *underscores* the need to improve the necessary capacity of the relevant Afghan institutions to address challenges posed by terrorism, narcotics, smuggling, money-laundering and organized crime;
uncertainties: The reference to the 'Security Council Committee pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999), 1989 (2011) and 2253 (2015)' is normalized here as 'SC 1267/1989/2253 Committee'; this specific committee is not listed explicitly in the provided entity list.

text: Humanitarian assistance

Notes with grave concern the dire humanitarian situation affecting Afghanistan, with millions of people facing emergency levels of food insecurity, acknowledges that women and children, including girls, are disproportionally affected by the humanitarian and economic crisis, urges the international community to provide, in accordance with international law, including international humanitarian law, and consistent with humanitarian principles, humanitarian assistance and financial resources to support humanitarian activities across Afghanistan, and calls for support to the 2022 Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: humanitarian assistance
financial resources
Support to 2022 Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan

textWithHighlights: *Notes with grave concern* the dire humanitarian situation affecting {{Afghanistan}}, with millions of people facing emergency levels of food insecurity, *acknowledges* that women and children, including girls, are disproportionally affected by the humanitarian and economic crisis, *urges* the <<international community>> to provide, in accordance with international law, including international humanitarian law, and consistent with humanitarian principles, [[humanitarian assistance]] and [[financial resources]] to support humanitarian activities across {{Afghanistan}}, and *calls for* [[support]] to the 2022 Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan;
uncertainties: "Support" to the 2022 Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan may include non-financial forms of assistance; it is categorized here as financial_resources based on typical HRP funding needs.

text: Takes note of Security Council resolution 2615 (2021) of 22 December 2021, in which the Council underlined that humanitarian assistance and other activities that support basic human needs in Afghanistan were not a violation of paragraph 1 (a) of Council resolution 2255 (2015) of 21 December 2015, while recalling the need to minimize and monitor the risk of aid diversion;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of {{Security Council}} resolution 2615 (2021) of 22 December 2021, in which {{the Council}} underlined that humanitarian assistance and other activities that support basic human needs in {{Afghanistan}} were not a violation of paragraph 1 (a) of Council resolution 2255 (2015) of 21 December 2015, while recalling the need to minimize and monitor the risk of aid diversion;

text: Calls upon all actors to work towards improving the accessibility of the full spectrum of activities by humanitarian and development agencies and personnel, including all Afghans across all ethnic groups, in all areas of the country, in support of all people in need, including women, children, displaced persons, minorities and persons with disabilities, as well as to support efforts to create conditions conducive to a voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return and reintegration of internally displaced persons and refugee populations, in particular those in neighbouring countries which have faced a major influx of refugees;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: improved access for humanitarian and development activities
conditions for voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return and reintegration of IDPs and refugees

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* all actors to work towards improving the [[accessibility]] of the full spectrum of activities by humanitarian and development agencies and personnel, including all Afghans across all ethnic groups, in all areas of the country, in support of all people in need, including women, children, displaced persons, minorities and persons with disabilities, as well as to support efforts to create conditions conducive to a voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable [[return and reintegration]] of internally displaced persons and refugee populations, in particular those in neighbouring countries which have faced a major influx of refugees;
uncertainties: "All actors" is too vague to map to a specific assignee category, so no assignee was recorded. The first deliverable (improving accessibility) is somewhat broad but treated as enabling humanitarian access.

text: Emphasizes in particular that the effective delivery of humanitarian assistance requires all actors to allow full, safe and unhindered humanitarian access for all humanitarian personnel, including women, for United Nations agencies, international and national non-governmental organizations, and other humanitarian actors, and affirms the importance of sustained engagement of the international community with Afghanistan, especially in supporting humanitarian and basic human needs of the Afghan people;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* in particular that the effective delivery of humanitarian assistance requires all actors to allow full, safe and unhindered humanitarian access for all humanitarian personnel, including women, for {{United Nations agencies}}, {{international and national non-governmental organizations}}, and other humanitarian actors, and *affirms* the importance of sustained engagement of the {{international community}} with {{Afghanistan}}, especially in supporting humanitarian and basic human needs of the Afghan people;
uncertainties: The verb 'affirms' is treated as an operative (reinforcing) verb even though it is not listed in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs. The clause 'requires all actors to allow ... access' implies a directive toward 'all actors', but it is embedded within a reinforcing paragraph ('Emphasizes') and thus no assignee or deliverable was extracted.

text: Social and economic development

Recognizes the necessity of improving the living conditions of the Afghan people, and therefore emphasizes the need to address basic human needs across Afghanistan, in particular equal access to basic services such as education and public health services, taking into account Security Council resolution 2615 (2021);
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the necessity of improving the living conditions of the Afghan people, and therefore *emphasizes* the need to address basic human needs across {{Afghanistan}}, in particular equal access to basic services such as education and public health services, taking into account {{Security Council}} resolution 2615 (2021);

text: Also recognizes the need to help to address the substantial challenges facing the economy of Afghanistan, including through efforts to restore the banking and financial systems as well as enabling access to assets belonging to the Central Bank of Afghanistan for the benefit of the Afghan people, acknowledges that the financial system of Afghanistan continues to face serious challenges, and calls upon all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders to create favourable conditions for economic activity and recovery by adhering to the rule of law, respecting fully civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights, ensuring educational rights for all Afghans, including women and girls, by providing responsible and accountable governance, and expanding the capacities and professionalism of Afghan institutions;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Create favourable economic conditions
Adherence to rule of law
deliverables.deliverable: adhering to the rule of law

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Respect for civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights
deliverables.deliverable: respecting fully civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Ensure educational rights for all
Responsible and accountable governance
Expand capacities and professionalism of Afghan institutions

textWithHighlights: Also *recognizes* the need to help to address the substantial challenges facing the economy of Afghanistan, including through efforts to restore the banking and financial systems as well as enabling access to assets belonging to the {{Central Bank of Afghanistan}} for the benefit of the Afghan people, *acknowledges* that the financial system of Afghanistan continues to face serious challenges, and *calls upon* all relevant <<Afghan political actors and stakeholders>> to [[create favourable conditions]] for economic activity and recovery by [[adhering to the rule of law]], [[respecting fully civil, political, social, economic and cultural rights]], [[ensuring educational rights]] for all Afghans, including women and girls, by [[providing responsible and accountable governance]], and [[expanding the capacities and professionalism]] of Afghan institutions;
uncertainties: The deliverables are broad and somewhat aspirational (e.g., “create favourable conditions”), so categorization into policy/standards/capacity building involves judgment. No explicit assignee for the initial recognizing/acknowledging clauses; deliverables linked only to the directive clause.

text: Encourages continued efforts, working with all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders, to contribute to supporting the provision of essential services to the Afghan population and to creating economic and social conditions that can lead to self-reliance and stability and to facilitate commercial and financial activity in Afghanistan for the benefit of the Afghan people, including through efforts to restore the banking and financial systems in Afghanistan;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Restoration of banking and financial systems in Afghanistan
deliverables.deliverable: restore the banking and financial systems

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* continued efforts, working with all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders, to contribute to supporting the provision of essential services to the Afghan population and to creating economic and social conditions that can lead to self-reliance and stability and to facilitate commercial and financial activity in Afghanistan for the benefit of the Afghan people, including through efforts to [[restore the banking and financial systems]] in Afghanistan;
uncertainties: No explicit assignee is stated; potential addressees (e.g., Member States, international community) are implied but unspecified. Other phrases (provision of essential services, facilitate commercial and financial activity) are broad, so only the restoration of banking and financial systems was captured as a concrete deliverable.

text: Recalls its concern about the adverse impact of climate change, natural disasters and environmental issues in Afghanistan, and emphasizes the urgent need to build resilience, especially for the most vulnerable, including through the revitalization of sustainable food systems;
textWithHighlights: *Recalls* its concern about the adverse impact of climate change, natural disasters and environmental issues in {{Afghanistan}}, and *emphasizes* the urgent need to build resilience, especially for the most vulnerable, including through the revitalization of sustainable food systems;

text: Refugees

Expresses its concern over the increase in the number of internally displaced persons in and refugees from Afghanistan, recalls the respective obligations of States under international refugee law with respect to the protection of refugees, to respect the principle of voluntary return of refugees and the right to seek asylum and to ensure full, safe and unhindered access for humanitarian relief agencies in order to provide protection and assistance to internally displaced persons and refugees, and calls upon States to continue to accept an appropriate number of Afghan refugees for resettlement, as a manifestation of their shared responsibility and solidarity;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Respect for voluntary return principle
Respect for right to seek asylum
Ensure humanitarian access
Resettlement of Afghan refugees

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its concern* over the increase in the number of internally displaced persons in and refugees from {{Afghanistan}}, *recalls* the respective obligations of <<States>> under international refugee law with respect to the protection of refugees, to respect the principle of [[voluntary return]] of refugees and the [[right to seek asylum]] and to ensure full, safe and unhindered [[access]] for humanitarian relief agencies in order to provide protection and assistance to internally displaced persons and refugees, and *calls upon* <<States>> to continue to accept an appropriate number of Afghan refugees for [[resettlement]], as a manifestation of their shared responsibility and solidarity;
uncertainties: Classifying ‘ensure access’ under policy (rather than humanitarian assistance) is somewhat judgment-based; it’s an enabling measure rather than direct aid.

text: Expresses its appreciation to those Governments that host Afghan refugees, in particular the Islamic Republic of Pakistan and the Islamic Republic of Iran, acknowledging the huge burden that they have so far shouldered as neighbouring States, calls for continued generous support by the international community, and also asks relevant international organizations, in particular the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the International Organization for Migration, to continue to work closely with all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders and the countries hosting Afghan refugees with a view to facilitating their voluntary, safe and dignified return and sustainable reintegration;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Continued generous support

assignees.assignee: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Facilitation of voluntary, safe and dignified return and sustainable reintegration of Afghan refugees

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its appreciation* to those Governments that host Afghan refugees, in particular the {{Islamic Republic of Pakistan}} and the {{Islamic Republic of Iran}}, acknowledging the huge burden that they have so far shouldered as neighbouring States, *calls for* [[continued generous support]] by the {{international community}}, and also *asks* relevant <<international organizations>>, in particular the <<Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees>> and the <<International Organization for Migration>>, to continue to work closely with all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders and the countries hosting Afghan refugees with a view to facilitating their voluntary, safe and dignified [[return and sustainable reintegration]];
uncertainties: Classified the deliverable under 'asks' as humanitarian_assistance; one could argue it is technical/operational support. Treated 'international organizations' as an assignee alongside UNHCR and IOM; broader phrasing may be considered generic, but it is specified by examples.

text: Recognizes the important role played by Kuwait, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates and other neighbouring and regional States in coordinating wider regional and global resettlement efforts for Afghan refugees;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the important role played by {{Kuwait}}, {{Qatar}}, the {{United Arab Emirates}} and {{other neighbouring and regional States}} in coordinating wider regional and global resettlement efforts for Afghan refugees;

text: Underlines the centrality of international cooperation to the refugee protection regime, recognizes the burden that large movements of refugees place on major and long-standing refugee-hosting countries and communities, as well as their national resources, especially in the case of developing countries, and calls for a more equitable sharing of the burden and responsibility for hosting and supporting the world’s refugees, addressing the needs of refugees and hosting States, while taking account of existing contributions and the differing capacities and resources among States;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: More equitable sharing of burden and responsibility for refugees

textWithHighlights: *Underlines* the centrality of international cooperation to the refugee protection regime, *recognizes* the burden that large movements of refugees place on major and long-standing refugee-hosting countries and communities, as well as their national resources, especially in the case of {{developing countries}}, and *calls for* a [[more equitable sharing]] of the burden and responsibility for hosting and supporting the world’s refugees, addressing the needs of refugees and hosting {{States}}, while taking account of existing contributions and the differing capacities and resources among {{States}};
uncertainties: The deliverable 'more equitable sharing' is categorized as a policy-level ask; it could also be interpreted as relating to financial resources/support. No explicit assignee is named for the 'calls for' clause.

text: Reaffirms that peace and stability, social and economic development, respect for human rights and inclusive government in Afghanistan would also contribute to the voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return of all Afghan refugees and internally displaced persons to play their constructive role in Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* that peace and stability, social and economic development, respect for human rights and inclusive government in {{Afghanistan}} would also contribute to the voluntary, safe, dignified and sustainable return of all Afghan refugees and internally displaced persons to play their constructive role in {{Afghanistan}};

text: Recognizes the important role played by neighbouring and regional States, including Pakistan, in coordinating wider regional and global resettlement efforts for Afghan refugees as well as facilitating the relocation of people of various nationalities from Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the important role played by {{neighbouring and regional States}}, including {{Pakistan}}, in coordinating wider regional and global resettlement efforts for Afghan refugees as well as facilitating the relocation of people of various nationalities from {{Afghanistan}};

text: Regional cooperation

Stresses the crucial importance of advancing constructive and sustainable regional cooperation as an effective means of promoting and complementing peace, security, stability and economic and social development in Afghanistan and the region, and recognizes in this regard the importance of the contribution of neighbouring and regional partners and regional organizations;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the crucial importance of advancing constructive and sustainable regional cooperation as an effective means of promoting and complementing peace, security, stability and economic and social development in {{Afghanistan}} and the region, and *recognizes* in this regard the importance of the contribution of neighbouring and regional partners and {{regional organizations}};

text: Recognizes the importance of the potential role of Afghanistan in connecting Central and South Asia, as well as its economic development and integration into interregional economic processes for lasting peace and stability;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the importance of the potential role of {{Afghanistan}} in connecting Central and South Asia, as well as its economic development and integration into interregional economic processes for lasting peace and stability;

text: Notes the historical role of Afghanistan as a land bridge in Asia, and recalls that regional economic cooperation plays an important role in achieving stability and development in Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Notes* the historical role of {{Afghanistan}} as a land bridge in Asia, and *recalls* that regional economic cooperation plays an important role in achieving stability and development in {{Afghanistan}};

text: Recognizes the importance of regional connectivity projects with Central Asia that can provide a pathway to economic growth and stabilization in Afghanistan;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the importance of regional connectivity projects with Central Asia that can provide a pathway to economic growth and stabilization in {{Afghanistan}};

text: Expresses appreciation for the commitment of neighbouring and regional partners to peace and stability in Afghanistan and Central Asia, for demonstrating unwavering support to the United Nations, and in this respect recognizes the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan for hosting in Almaty in crucial times a temporary remote office of the United Nations presence in Afghanistan;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan

textWithHighlights: *Expresses appreciation* for the commitment of neighbouring and regional partners to peace and stability in {{Afghanistan}} and Central Asia, for demonstrating unwavering support to the {{United Nations}}, and in this respect *recognizes* the {{Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan}} for hosting in Almaty in crucial times a temporary remote office of the {{United Nations}} presence in {{Afghanistan}};

text: Welcomes the work of the United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the work of the {{United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia}};

text: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan

Fully supports the work of the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan, as mandated by the Security Council in its resolution 2626 (2022), stresses the critical importance of the continued presence of the Mission and other United Nations agencies, funds and programmes across Afghanistan, and expresses its appreciation for the appointment of the new Special Representative of the Secretary-General for Afghanistan;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan

textWithHighlights: *Fully supports* the work of the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}}, as mandated by the {{Security Council}} in its resolution 2626 (2022), *stresses* the critical importance of the continued presence of the Mission and other {{United Nations agencies}}, {{funds}} and {{programmes}} across Afghanistan, and *expresses its appreciation* for the appointment of the new Special Representative of the {{Secretary-General}} for Afghanistan;
uncertainties: The "Special Representative of the Secretary-General for Afghanistan" is referenced but not in the provided entity list; thus only "Secretary-General" is highlighted and captured as a mentioned entity.

text: Reiterates the necessity for all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders as well as international actors to coordinate with the Mission and other United Nations agencies, funds and programmes across Afghanistan in the implementation of their mandates and to ensure the safety, security and freedom of movement of United Nations and associated personnel, irrespective of gender, throughout the country;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* the necessity for all relevant Afghan political actors and stakeholders as well as international actors to coordinate with the {{Mission}} and other {{United Nations agencies}}, {{funds}} and {{programmes}} across Afghanistan in the implementation of their mandates and to ensure the safety, security and freedom of movement of {{United Nations}} and associated personnel, irrespective of gender, throughout the country;
uncertainties: The paragraph expresses a necessity rather than a direct request; thus no assignees or deliverables were extracted. “Mission” is assumed to refer to UNAMA based on context.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to continue to report every three months on developments in Afghanistan, as well as on the progress made in the implementation of the present resolution;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Quarterly reports on Afghanistan developments and implementation progress

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to continue to [[report every three months]] on developments in {{Afghanistan}}, as well as on the progress made in the implementation of the present resolution;

text: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-ninth session the item entitled “The situation in Afghanistan”.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Inclusion of agenda item "The situation in Afghanistan" in GA 79 provisional agenda

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to include in the [[provisional agenda]] of its seventy-ninth session the item entitled “The situation in Afghanistan”.
uncertainties: The deliverable is interpreted as the inclusion of the agenda item in the GA’s provisional agenda; alternatively, one could highlight the specific item title as the deliverable.

text: 33rd plenary meeting
10 November 2022
